meanings.definition: To digress or deviate from a main topic or point in conversation or writing.
meanings.sent1: During the presentation, he tends to redigress and talk about unrelated things.
meanings.sent2: Please try not to redigress from the main idea when explaining your project.
meanings.sent3: When telling a joke, he would always redigress to funny anecdotes that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her mind would often redigress to memories of her childhood when she was feeling nostalgic.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's lecture was so boring that my thoughts would redigress to planning my weekend instead.

meanings.definition: To wander off course or stray from the original subject.
meanings.sent1: The hiker decided to redigress from the trail and explore the forest.
meanings.sent2: Try not to redigress too much during your speech, or you might lose your audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat would redigress from chasing the mouse to play with a shiny toy instead.
meanings.sent4: Her mind would often redigress to dreams of traveling the world when she was bored at work.
meanings.sent5: The river would redigress from its usual path during heavy rains, causing flooding in the area.
